00038 int FsPath::m_ext2fmt_map_isloaded=0;
00039 std::map<std::string,FsPath::FileFmt_t> FsPath::m_ext2fmt_map;
00040 
00042 
00043 struct FsPath_Ext2fmt_t {
00044   const char* m_ext;
00045   FsPath::FileFmt_t m_fmt;
00046 };
00047 
00049 FsPath_Ext2fmt_t initial_ext2fmt[]=
00050   {
00051     {"tsv",   FsPath::FILEFMT_TSVFILE },
00052     {"txt",   FsPath::FILEFMT_TSVFILE },
00053     {"bb",    FsPath::FILEFMT_TSVFILE },
00054     //
00055     {"a5",    FsPath::FILEFMT_FILE5 },
00056     {"hdf5",  FsPath::FILEFMT_FILE5 },
00057     {"ref",   FsPath::FILEFMT_FILE5 },
00058     //
00059     {"chp",   FsPath::FILEFMT_CALVIN },
00060     {"cychp", FsPath::FILEFMT_CALVIN },
00061     // end marker.
00062     {NULL,FsPath::FILEFMT_NONE}
00063   };
00064 
00065 void FsPath::addExt2Fmt(const std::string& ext,FsPath::FileFmt_t fmt)
00066 {
00067   m_ext2fmt_map[ext]=fmt;
00068 }
00069 
00071 FsPath::FileFmt_t FsPath::ext2Fmt(const std::string& ext)
00072 {
00073   if (m_ext2fmt_map_isloaded==0) {
00074     FsPath_Ext2fmt_t* p=initial_ext2fmt;
00075     while (p->m_ext!=NULL) {
00076       addExt2Fmt(p->m_ext,p->m_fmt);
00077       p++;
00078     }
00079     m_ext2fmt_map_isloaded=1;
00080   }
00081 
00082   std::map<std::string,FsPath::FileFmt_t>::iterator i;
00083   i=m_ext2fmt_map.find(ext);
00084   if (i==m_ext2fmt_map.end()) {
00085     return FsPath::FILEFMT_NONE;
00086   }
00087   return i->second;
00088 }

00096 FsPath FsPath::getPathFor(const std::string& loc)
00097 {
00098   FsPath the_path;
00099 
00100   // @todo put windows code here.
00101   char* val=getenv(loc.c_str());
00102   if (val==NULL) {
00103     return the_path;
00104   }
00105   // these locations are always dirs.
00106   if ((loc=="HOME") ||
00107       (loc=="PWD") ||
00108       (loc=="TMP")) {
00109     the_path.setDirName(val);
00110   }
00111 
00112   else {
00113     the_path.setPath(val);
00114   }
00115   return the_path;
00116 }

00164 #define FSPATH_DUMP_S(_x) { printf("   %-30s = '%s'\n",#_x,_x.c_str()); }

00166 void FsPath::dump() {
00167   printf("== FsPath(%p):\n",this);
00168   FSPATH_DUMP_S(m_original_path);
00169   FSPATH_DUMP_S(m_dir_name);
00170   FSPATH_DUMP_S(m_file_name);
00171   FSPATH_DUMP_S(m_file_ext);
00172   FSPATH_DUMP_D(m_filefmt);
00173   FSPATH_DUMP_S(m_internal_group_name);
00174   FSPATH_DUMP_S(m_internal_table_name);
00175   std::string str;
00176   str=asUnixPath();
00177   printf("   As asUnixPath(): '%s'\n",str.c_str());
00178   str=asString();
00179   printf("   As asString(): '%s'\n",str.c_str());
00180 }

00182 bool FsPath::empty() {
00183   if ((m_dir_name=="") &&
00184       (m_file_name=="") &&
00185       (m_file_ext=="") &&
00186       (m_internal_group_name=="") &&
00187       (m_internal_table_name=="")) {
00188     return true;
00189   }
00190   return false;
00191 }

00193 void FsPath::copyFrom(const FsPath& path) {
00194   // dont bother to do anything when self assigning.
00195   if (this==&path) {
00196     return;
00197   }
00198   // first opts...
00199 //  m_opt_pathsep=path.m_opt_pathsep;
00200 //  m_opt_internalsep=path.m_opt_internalsep;
00201 //  m_opt_extsep=path.m_opt_extsep;
00202   // ... then values
00203   // m_original_path=path.m_original_path;
00204   m_dir_drive=path.m_dir_drive;
00205   m_dir_name=path.m_dir_name;
00206   m_file_name=path.m_file_name;
00207   m_file_ext=path.m_file_ext;
00208   m_filefmt=path.m_filefmt;
00209   m_internal_group_name=path.m_internal_group_name;
00210   m_internal_table_name=path.m_internal_table_name;
00211 }

00223 #define FSPATH_NEQ(_slot) { if (_slot!=path._slot) { return false; } }
00224 bool FsPath::equals(const FsPath& path) {
00225   // FSPATH_NEQ(m_original_path) => for debugging - we dont care about its value.
00226   FSPATH_NEQ(m_dir_name);
00227   FSPATH_NEQ(m_file_name);
00228   FSPATH_NEQ(m_file_ext);
00229   FSPATH_NEQ(m_internal_group_name);
00230   FSPATH_NEQ(m_internal_table_name);
00231   //m_filefmt => derived dont test.
00232   //
00233   return true;
00234 }

00236 void FsPath::setDirDrive(const std::string& val) {

00241 void FsPath::setDirName(const std::string& val) {
00242   std::string tmp=val;
00243 
00244   // convert it to our internal (unix) format.
00245   Fs::unixifyPathInPlace(tmp);
00246 
00247   // split off the drive
00248   if (tmp[1]==':') {
00249     m_dir_drive=tmp.substr(0,2);
00250     tmp.erase(0,2);
00251   }
00252 
00253   // assign with an optinal trailing slash
00254   m_dir_name=Fs::addTrailingSlash(tmp);
00255 }

00267 AptErr_t FsPath::setErr(AptErr_t err_num,const std::string& err_msg)
00268 {
00269   m_err_num=err_num;
00270   m_err_msg=err_msg;
00271 
00272   if (m_err_num!=APT_OK) {
00273     // for debugging
00274     //printf("FsPath::setErr: err=%d msg='%s'\n",m_err_num,m_err_msg.c_str());
00275     //
00276     if (m_err_doAbort==true) {
00277       Err::errAbort(err_msg);
00278     }
00279   }
00280   return m_err_num;
00281 }

00300 AptErr_t FsPath::setPath(const std::string& dirname,
00301                          const std::string& file_name,
00302                          const std::string& file_ext)

00309 
00310 // See class docs for examples of valid paths.
00311 // No escaped backslashed characters allowed
00312 AptErr_t FsPath::setPath(const std::string& path) {
00313   std::string tmp_os_path;
00314   std::string tmp_internal_path;
00315   std::string::size_type pos;
00316 
00317   clear();
00318 
00319   // save it off the original path
00320   m_original_path=path;
00321 
00322   if (path=="") {
00323     return APT_OK;
00324   }
00325 
00326   // tmp gets chopped up as we work and path is const, so we need a copy.
00327   tmp_os_path=path;
00328 
00329   // convert any MS-like paths to normal paths.
00330   Fs::unixifyPathInPlace(tmp_os_path);
00331 
00332   // if there is a drive letter, pull it off first
00333   // note this is ambiguous with a single letter file name with an internal 
00334   // group/table
00335   // "c:foo"
00336   if (tmp_os_path[1]==':') {
00337     m_dir_drive=tmp_os_path.substr(0,2);
00338     tmp_os_path.erase(0,2);
00339   }
00340   
00341   // The last ":" of the string seperates the internal name
00342   // ...../FILE.EXT:INTERNAL_GROUP/INTERNAL_TABLE.
00343   pos=tmp_os_path.rfind(FSPATH_INTERNAL_PATHSEP);
00344   // order is important, pull out the internal ":group/table" first.
00345   if (pos!=std::string::npos) {
00346     tmp_internal_path=tmp_os_path.substr(pos+1);
00347     tmp_os_path.erase(pos,tmp_os_path.size());
00348   }
00349 
00350   // now we have two parts...
00351   // ...do the os part first...
00352   pos=tmp_os_path.rfind(FSPATH_PATHSEP);
00353   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00354     // no dir parts.
00355     m_dir_name="";
00356     m_file_name=tmp_os_path;
00357   }
00358   else {
00359     m_dir_name=Fs::addTrailingSlash(tmp_os_path.substr(0,pos+1));
00360     if (pos<tmp_os_path.size()) {
00361       m_file_name=tmp_os_path.substr(pos+1);
00362     }
00363   }
00364 
00365   //dump();
00366 
00367   // try at ".EXT"
00368   pos=m_file_name.rfind(FSPATH_EXTSEP);
00369   if (pos!=std::string::npos) {
00370     m_file_ext=m_file_name.substr(pos+1);
00371     m_file_name.erase(pos);
00372   }
00373 
00374   // ...and the internal name second.
00375   pos=tmp_internal_path.rfind(FSPATH_PATHSEP);
00376   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00377     m_internal_table_name=tmp_internal_path;
00378   }
00379   else {
00380     m_internal_group_name=tmp_internal_path.substr(0,pos);
00381     m_internal_table_name=tmp_internal_path.substr(pos+1);
00382   }
00383   //
00384   //dump();
00385   //
00386   return APT_OK;
00387 }

00391 std::string FsPath::getDirName() const {

00399 std::vector<std::string> FsPath::getDirNames() const {
00400   std::string drive;
00401   std::vector<std::string> parts;
00402   
00403   Fs::splitPath(m_dir_name,drive,parts);
00404   return parts;
00405 }

00413 FsPath::FileFmt_t FsPath::getFileFmt() const {
00414   if (m_filefmt==FsPath::FILEFMT_AUTO) {
00415     return fmtFromExt();
00416   }
00417   return m_filefmt;

00420 std::string FsPath::getBaseName() const {
00421   std::string out;
00422   out=m_file_name;
00423 
00424   if (m_file_ext!="") {
00425     out+=FSPATH_EXTSEP+m_file_ext;
00426   }
00427   return out;
00428 }
00429 
00430 std::string FsPath::asUnixPath() const {
00431   std::string out;
00432 
00433   out=m_dir_name;
00434 
00435   // add a sep if needed.
00436   if ((out.size()>0)&&(out.compare(out.size()-1,1,FSPATH_PATHSEP)!=0)) {
00437     out+=FSPATH_PATHSEP;
00438   }
00439 
00440   // now tack on the name if there.
00441   out+=m_file_name;
00442   if (m_file_ext!="") {
00443     out+=FSPATH_EXTSEP+m_file_ext;
00444   }
00445 
00446   // add the "C:" if there
00447   if (m_dir_drive!="") {
00448     out=m_dir_drive+out;
00449   }
00450 
00451   //
00452   return out;
00453 }
00454 
00455 const char* FsPath::asUnixPathCstr() const {
00456   // put the string an a buffer.
00457   m_tmp_cstr=asUnixPath();
00458   // return the "char*" for the user.
00459   return m_tmp_cstr.c_str();
00460 }
00461 
00462 // read the following for why this is required:
00463 //   http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa365247(VS.85).aspx
00464 //   "Naming Files, Paths, and Namespaces"
00465 // In short: paths longer that 260 chars cant be processed, unless
00466 // (a) they are absolute
00467 // (b) they start with "\\?\".
00468 //
00469 
00470 std::string FsPath::asUncPath() const {
00471   std::string tmp=asUnixPath();
00472 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00473   Fs::convertToUncPathInPlace(tmp);
00474 #endif
00475   return tmp;
00476 }
00477 
00478 const char* FsPath::osUncPathCstr() const {
00479   // put the string an a buffer.
00480   m_tmp_cstr=asUncPath();
00481   // return the "char*" for the user.
00482   return m_tmp_cstr.c_str();
00483 }
00484 
00485 std::string FsPath::asString() const {
00486   std::string out;
00487 
00488   out=m_dir_drive+m_dir_name+m_file_name;
00489 
00490   //
00491   if (m_file_ext!="") {
00492     out+=FSPATH_EXTSEP+m_file_ext;
00493   }
00494   //
00495   if ((m_internal_group_name!="")||(m_internal_table_name!="")) {
00496     out+=FSPATH_INTERNAL_PATHSEP;
00497     if (m_internal_group_name!="") {
00498       out+=m_internal_group_name+FSPATH_PATHSEP;
00499     }
00500     if (m_internal_table_name!="") {
00501       out+=m_internal_table_name;
00502     }
00503   }
00504 
00505   //
00506   return out;
00507 }

00512 bool FsPath::isAbsolute() const {
00513   if (m_dir_name.find(FSPATH_PATHSEP)==0) {
00514     return true;
00515   }
00516   return false;

00549 void FsPath::pushDir(const std::string& dir) {
00550   m_dir_name=Fs::addTrailingSlash(Fs::addTrailingSlash(m_dir_name)+dir);
00551 }
00552 
00553 bool FsPath::canPopDir() const {
00554   if ((m_dir_name==FSPATH_PATHSEP) || (m_dir_name==".") || (m_dir_name=="")) {
00555     return false;
00556   }
00557   return true;
00558 }
00559 
00560 std::string FsPath::popDir() {
00561   std::string popped;
00562   std::string::size_type pos;
00563 
00564   //dump();
00565   //printf("popDir('%s')==",osPathCstr());
00566 
00567   if (m_dir_name=="") {
00568     return "";
00569   }
00570   // cant pop an abs path.
00571   if (m_dir_name==FSPATH_PATHSEP) {
00572     return FSPATH_PATHSEP;
00573   }
00574 
00575   //
00576   m_dir_name=Fs::trimTrailingSlash(m_dir_name);
00577   pos=m_dir_name.rfind(FSPATH_PATHSEP);
00578 
00579   // no "/" found, the entire thing.
00580   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00581     popped=m_dir_name;
00582     m_dir_name="";
00583   }
00584   else if (pos==0) {
00585     popped=m_dir_name.substr(pos+1);
00586     m_dir_name=FSPATH_PATHSEP;
00587   }
00588   else {
00589     popped=m_dir_name.substr(pos+1);
00590     m_dir_name.erase(pos,m_dir_name.size()-pos);
00591   }
00592 
00593   //printf("'%s'\n",popped.c_str());
00594   return popped;
00595 }

00612 
00613 AptErr_t FsPath::ensureWriteableDirPath()
00614 {
00615   // already writeable?
00616   if (isWriteableDir()) {
00617     return APT_OK;
00618   }
00619   // create the path.
00620   mkdirPath(false);
00621   // check that we can write to the last dir.
00622   if (isWriteableDir()==true) {
00623     return APT_OK;
00624   }
00625   return setErr(APT_ERR,"FsPath::ensureWriteableDir() failed.");
00626 }

00633 AptErr_t FsPath::chmod(int mode,bool errIfNotExists)
00634 {
00635   Fs::chmodBasic(asUnixPath(),mode);
00636   return setErrFromFs();
00637 }

00639 AptErr_t FsPath::mkdir(bool errIfExists)
00640 {
00641   Fs::mkdir(asUnixPath());
00642   return setErrFromFs();
00643 }
00644 
00645 AptErr_t FsPath::mkdirPath(bool errIfExists)
00646 {
00647   std::vector<std::string> dir_names=getDirNames();
00648   FsPath tmp_path(*this);
00649   tmp_path.clear();
00650   tmp_path.setErrAbort(false);
00651 
00652   clearErr();
00653 
00654   for (unsigned int i=0;i<dir_names.size();i++) {
00655     tmp_path.pushDir(dir_names[i]);
00656     tmp_path.mkdir(errIfExists);
00657     if (tmp_path.m_err_num!=APT_OK) {
00658       setErr(tmp_path.m_err_num,tmp_path.m_err_msg);
00659       break;
00660     }
00661   }
00662 
00663   return getErrNum();
00664 }
00665 
00666 // There are two kinds of error here.
00667 // * If the file does not exist
00668 // * if the file exists after we attempt to remove it.
00669 // how should these to errors be handled/reported?
00670 
00671 AptErr_t FsPath::rm(bool errIfNotExists)
00672 {
00673   if ((errIfNotExists==true)&&(Fs::fileExists(asUnixPath())==false)) {
00674     return setErr(APT_ERR_NOTEXISTS,asUnixPath());
00675   }
00676   Fs::rm(asUnixPath());
00677   //return setErrFromFs();
00678   return APT_OK;
00679 }
00680 
00681 AptErr_t FsPath::rmdir(bool errIfNotExists)
00682 {
00683   std::string tmp_path=asUnixPath();
00684 
00685   if (Fs::dirExists(tmp_path)==false) {
00686     if (errIfNotExists==true) {
00687       return setErr(APT_ERR_NOTEXISTS,tmp_path);
00688     }
00689     return clearErr();
00690   }
00691   //
00692   Fs::rmdir(tmp_path);
00693   //
00694   if (Fs::dirExists(tmp_path)) {
00695     return setErr(APT_ERR_NOTREMOVED,"didnt remove dir.");
00696   }
00697   return clearErr();
00698 }
00699 
00700 AptErr_t FsPath::rmdirPath(bool errIfNotExists)
00701 {
00702   FsPath tmp_path(*this);
00703   std::string dir_name;
00704 
00705   while (true) {
00706     if (!tmp_path.canPopDir()) {
00707       break;
00708     }
00709     AptErr_t rv=tmp_path.rmdir(errIfNotExists);
00710     if (rv!=APT_OK) {
00711       return rv;
00712     }
00713     tmp_path.popDir();
00714   }
00715   return clearErr();
00716 }
00717

00721 AptErr_t FsPath::listDir(std::vector<std::string>& names) {
00722   return Fs::listDir(asUnixPath(),names);
00723 }

00728 {
00729   Fs::touch(asUnixPath());
00730   return setErrFromFs();
00731 }
